Prefer time explanation: Es ist übersichtlicher und wirkt ansprechender

Prefer time explanation: It's not possible to see exactly the time range chosen in the micro visualization, which is okay unless the intention is to make it memorable
Prefer geo explanation: the map is definitely more appealing (which has nothing to do with remembering latter)
Prefer category explanation: I prefer the first one because of the colors and hexagons are nice. I think in both cases it'd be more understandable if one could see full names.
more information time explanation: If you mean more information in terms of how well I can remember, then the numbers are easier to remember. The micro visualization tells more about how many resources are included in that time range. So, it's a bit hard to answer this kin of question
more information geo explanation: Text is more specific but a map provides a better overviwew
more information category explanation: It's the same information just in a more colourful way. In any case, I don't know what "ro" and "hu" stand for. It would be more understandable to use full language names or flags

Prefer time explanation: it's easier to identify and understand
Prefer geo explanation: details easily identified

more information time explanation: i see more
more information geo explanation: i get the information needed clearer

Prefer time explanation: Both easily readable, with more insights in the graphical visualisation
Prefer geo explanation: You need more background knowledge about geography to relate the city names to a region.
Prefer category explanation: The non-textual visualisation does of course give more insights about the quantity of the selected languages, but the hexagons don't relate to any quality of languages
more information time explanation: More details about the distribution within the selected time frame
more information geo explanation: I'd say it depends on a person's background. The map is easier to scan quickly but the second one is more helpful if you don't know exactly where the selected cities are located on a map

Prefer time explanation: Eine Zeittafel mit verschiedenen Farben sind sehr übersichtlich
Prefer geo explanation: Eine Landkarte ist übersichtlicher
Prefer category explanation: Bei der Sprache brauche ich keine Felder.
more information time explanation: Exakte Jahrgänge können besser angegeben werden.
more information geo explanation: Wenn sich jemand nicht gut in der Geografie auskennt, ist die gewählte Methode besser.

Prefer time explanation: Written form is easier to keep in mind.  Exact dates are hard to extract from the visual time representation.
Prefer geo explanation: Selected area can easily be memorized. Written cities require a lot more thought and knowledge to pin point and recreate the very same area within ones mind.
Prefer category explanation: I find both forms appealing. Written form might be a bit more memorable due to the exclusion of the other possible choices. Probably a question of personal preferences.
more information time explanation: Due to the individual timelines.
more information geo explanation: Names capitals within the selection, might otherwise be unknown to user.
more information category explanation: Shows amount of results corresponding to each category item, which is left out in the written form.

Prefer time explanation: because it is precise and clear. In this particular case the data represented on the other chart is meaningless I can only guess the time interval but it is easier to remember because of the visual distribution of color.
Prefer geo explanation: both are complementary, but I still prefer the map
Prefer category explanation: the visual representation is more appealing and therefore easily remembered
more information time explanation: I can judge the amount/density of information (but not the content) because of the shapes and colors associated to that window.
more information geo explanation: An highlighted area on the world map provides richer mental associations than a list of city names.
more information category explanation: Seeing highlighted the languages in the wider context of all the available languages allows for disambiguation(if any doubt persists),(suggestion: the color used on the hexagon could be in some cases flag colors)

Prefer time explanation: The information in the second visualisation is more compact and therefore easier to read and remember
Prefer geo explanation: As not everybody is a geography genius, I assume one can not relate all country names to their location, so the first visualisation is easier to understand
Prefer category explanation: In fact both visualisations are fine and easy to read, but the first one is visually prettier and in contrast to the second one it also gives information about the amount of filter results for the language categories
more information time explanation: First one shows more details on filter results (specific times), but the exact time range is harder to read due to missing axis description
more information geo explanation: Second definitely provides more detailed information, but only for people who can relate all countries to locations
more information category explanation: Both provide the same information about langues chosen, but the first additionally about the amount of associated filter results

Prefer time explanation: Because time is better seen in numerical values.

more information time explanation: It seperates the categories too in the timeline.
more information geo explanation: The map can give you a better overview over which region is marked.
more information category explanation: They both provide the same information.
